history.content:
Last semester EE141 (and EE241) and CS150 had the same lecture and exams (this was the first time that 141 and 150 were combined into one lecture).  The only difference between the classes was discussion sections/labs.  As far as I know, the GSIs for 141 and 150 did basically the same things in section.  The main difference between the two classes was the lab sections/projects.  

Those of us in 150 did our labs/project on FPGAs, while 141 did theirs in ASICs.  Both projects involved designing a pipelined RISC-V CPU, but the 141 project did seem easier than the 150 project, at least based on the few conversations I overheard.  For example, the 150 project required that we implement a line-drawing engine, which quite a few groups never got around to completing because of setbacks in earlier parts of the project.  Students in 141 weren't struggling with the project as much as 150 students based off of what I heard from my peers.  

The project is really what made 150 an "8" unit course.  A large majority of students in 150 would be in the lab until 2 or 3 in the morning every day for the month or so that we were working on the project.  With respect to workload from other classes, I personally took two other technical classes (albeit one was a 3 unit grad class that was relatively easy) and a nontechnical class when I was taking 150.  It was manageable, but if I were to do it again I probably would try to take 150 in a semester when I had a lighter course load.  Again, my comparison between the two classes and my experience is just that -- my personal experience.

I was contemplating on taking either one of these courses for next semester.  Possibly with EE128 and EE137A.

I heard that they share the same lectures, however what are their differences logistic wise?  Would it be wise to 

take two other techs with either one of these courses?

Thanks
history.subject: EE141 Vs CS150
